title: Guarding the Patchwork

panel_structure.description: The Architect as fighter in defensive stance, armor partially revealing the patchwork beneath. Fierce protection posture but with visible vulnerability. The patchwork glows with borrowed but precious pieces.

Close-up of patchwork identity—each piece clearly borrowed (parent's fear, society's dream, culture's value) but woven into coherent whole. Hands holding it with both tenderness and fierce protection. Light showing it's imperfect but functional.
panel_structure.focus: The necessary patchwork we call self

transformation_notes: This scene transforms the discovery of borrowed identity (from Scene 122) into understanding why we defend it so fiercely. Not delusion but survival—the patchwork is all we've got.
dialogue_rhythm: From confused vulnerability to fierce recognition to compassionate acceptance
narrator_role: Compassionate witness to the necessity of borrowed identity
